body:
<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack install intel-oneapi-compilers
[+] /p/system/packages/spack/opt/spack/linux-sles12-haswell/gcc-10.2.0/patchelf-0.10-uvuvmm3bmhijhrohulbi4v2ekhsadmab
==> Installing intel-oneapi-compilers-2021.1-3mm776c7ro425u262sbxpaykibawcmjg
==> No binary for intel-oneapi-compilers-2021.1-3mm776c7ro425u262sbxpaykibawcmjg found: installing from source
==> Fetching https://registrationcenter-download.intel.com/akdlm/irc_nas/17427/l_HPCKit_p_2021.1.2684_offline.sh
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Warning: The contents of the archive look like HTML.  Either the URL you are trying to use does not exist or you have an internet gateway issue.  You can remove the bad archive using 'spack clean <package>', then try again using the correct URL.
==> Error: ChecksumError: sha256 checksum failed for /tmp/linstead/spack-stage/spack-stage-intel-oneapi-compilers-2021.1-3mm776c7ro425u262sbxpaykibawcmjg/l_HPCKit_p_2021.1.2684_offline.sh
    Expected 666b1002de3eab4b6f3770c42bcf708743ac74efeba4c05b0834095ef27a11b9 but got 114cf566ea583b8a5e9367b180e969bfd1e0194f772d3f373c597d082b4f8388

/p/system/packages/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py:1335, in do_fetch:
       1332        self.stage.fetch(mirror_only, err_msg=err_msg)
       1333        self._fetch_time = time.time() - start_time
       1334
  >>   1335        if checksum and self.version in self.versions:
       1336            self.stage.check()
       1337
       1338        self.stage.cache_local()
```

Download URL is indeed a 404, also when logged in to my Intel account. The correct URL seems to be very slightly different:

https://registrationcenter-download.intel.com/akdlm/irc_nas/17427/l_HPCKit_p_2021.1.0.2684_offline.sh

(note extra "0." in the URL)

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->
```console
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.1-2-393a105c06
* **Python:** 3.6.2
* **Platform:** linux-sles12-haswell
```
<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

### Additional information

<!-- Please upload the following files. They should be present in the stage directory of the failing build. Also upload any config.log or similar file if one exists. -->
* [spack-build-out.txt]() - not generated
* [spack-build-env.txt]() - not generated

<!-- Some packages have maintainers who have volunteered to debug build failures. Run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mention them here if they exist. -->
 @rscohn2 

### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [ ] I have uploaded the build log and environment files (not generated in my case)
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate

Thanks!
title: Installation issue: intel-oneapi-compilers
